metadata.dc:description: The vegetarian diet is becoming more frequent in our patients.The food intake is based exclusively on plant products, with some less strict diets including the consumption of egg and/or milk. It is associated to a lower rate of obesity, cardiovascular disease, diabetes and cáncer, however, it provides a lower contribution of energy and protein, it being possible to find vitamin B12 deficit, among others. VitaminB12 can only be obtained through the consumption of animal products. Its deficit can provoke anemia, neurological and psychiatrics disorders, and cognitive function alterations. Lack of vitamin B12 is the principal risk for vegetarians. To avoid it, they should eat vitamin B12 enriched foods, take vitamin B12 supplements or eat milk or eggs. Well-planned vegetarian diets are sure and healthy, but if they are inadequate they can produce nutritional deficits, among them that of vitamin B12 (AU)
